p: A total of about 47 flower visits of M. micrantha were observed for each inflorescence per day, with Apidae (bees), Calliphoridae (flies), Syrphidae (flies) and other pollinators accounting for 61.2, 22.0, 12.4, and 4.4 % of total visits, respectively, in monoculture (Table 2). Overall flower visiting behavior and visitation rate of Apidae, Calliphoridae and Syrphidae per inflorescence were substantially reduced with increasing proportions of sweet potato (P < 0.05).
